the-power-of-habit.name: The Power of Habit
the-power-of-habit.fullName: The Power of Habit: Why We Do What We Do in Life and Business

points.1: Superfast page load with incremental static regeneration ( ISR )
points.2: Extra client-server transport layer with HTTP proxy
points.2-1: Saving authorization token as an http-only cookie
points.2-2: Pass every API through the HTTP proxy and add the auth token to header
points.2-3: This way accessing token is a lot harder for malicious users (not impossible of course)
points.2-4: This method makes it possible to do more interesting and useful pieces of stuff like :
points.5-2: Defining canonical tags to avoid duplicate content
points.5-3: Adding schema tag ( rich result ) for media, breadcrumbs, ...
points.6-1: Cache first - Network fallback strategy for layout, fonts, logos, avatar and other important data
points.6-2: Reading important data from cache and if failed fallback to network
points.6-3: Rendering a no network connection for completely disabled network connection cases
points.7: Faster and more user-friendly image load with the image optimization method
points.7-1: Loading images based on dimensions of the image and saving a lot of data and time
points.7-2: Showing a blurred version of the image at first makes waiting for larger images a lot more pleasant
points.7-3: Showing shimmer animation for unknown images that can't be blurred
points.8: Secure coding with front-end security checks
points.9: Mobile App User experience for PWA users by using mobile native components like a bottom sheet, bottom tabs navigator, and ...

uneed.description: A platform for free posting of advertisements and inquiries regarding the purchase and sale of new and used products.

points.1: Using Next.js framework for server-side rendering
points.4: Using redux-saga as a redux async middleware
points.5: Combining socket.io and redux to create a sticky chat floating on the bottom of the layout and a chat page.

points.2: Using Context API for state management (for data that isn't changing frequently to cause performance issues)

points.2-2: Both server-side and client-side redux support with synced isomorphic redux state
points.2-3: SSR data prefetching and passing it to pages as props
points.3: Caching requests with Redis key-value pair database

crm.name: CRM Panel

points.1: Using socket.io for real-time communication with the server

points.3: Connecting to Telegram, WhatsApp, and Instagram accounts

about.title: About Me
about.p1: Hey, I'm Milad. I'm a 23 y.o. developer, mentor, student, and at late nights writer!
about.p2: I work at Arsh Co. as head of the front-end development team, I am working as a front-end developer since my early university years and I'm enjoying every bit of it.
about.p3: I grew up in Shahr-e-Rey, a district in the south of Tehran state.
about.p4: After spending my elementary and middle school, I got accepted for NODET and spent my high school there.
about.p5: After I was ranked 697 on the National entrance exam, I got accepted to study electrical engineering at Shahid Beheshti University
about.p6: I really didn't feel good about being an electrical engineer and after a couple of semesters, I changed my field to computer engineering at Islamic Azad University.
about.p7: I spend my free time reading, listening to music, watching tv shows, and enjoying time with my close friends.

timeline.title: Timeline
timeline.born_desc: Born and raised as a single child ...
timeline.earlySchool_desc: when I was 4, I took a test to see if I'm ready for school and I passed it! but I was even smaller than kids my age so my parents decided that I stick to the routine.
timeline.startingSchool_desc: Nothing special to say about this, like every other Iranian kid, I went to a school under a system that kill the creativity and happiness of students.
timeline.firstComputer_desc: My father bought a computer for my 10th birthday, Whoa!
timeline.choosingNationalExamPath_desc: I was hopelessly in love with Mathematics, I always dreamed my 40 y.o. version to be a bald skinny, not attractive professor who hates kids, but after putting all my efforts and love into learning it, I decided to concentrate on the national entrance exam.
timeline.university_desc: Endeavor paid off! I got accepted to study electrical engineering at Shahid Beheshti University, couldn't be happier but ...
timeline.tookCoupleOfSemestersOff_desc: I took a couple of semesters off to work on companies and professional teams.
timeline.changingField_desc: After one year of flip-flopping, I decided to change my field of study to computer engineering. I can't forget the hell my parents raised because of my decision.
timeline.firstDayAtWork_desc: As a night owl, I had a firm reason to hate that day and the days ahead, but my love for learning and competing, helped me keep going.
timeline.growingMyHair: This is when I started to grow my hair :)
timeline.leftMyFirstJob_desc: As time goes by, I realized it wasn't really anything to learn for me in that company, so I officially quit my first job
timeline.startingAtAppTech_desc: I found a good company to experience new challenges. I improved my React knowledge there and learned React Native.
timeline.startingAtArshCo_desc: After reaching a good knowledge of React, I decided to have a new challenge and work on larger projects and I chose Arsh Company to continue. despite my last superiors, they were really nice to me
timeline.becomingTeamLead_desc: I proved myself to headquarters in my challenges and became head of the front-end development team.
timeline.ielts_desc: I passed my IELTS exam with a 7 score.
